title: Could Your Plastic Kettle Be Harming Your Health? | 10 News+
description: Could your morning cuppa actually be bad for you? New research from the University of Queensland has revealed micro and nano-plastics are leaching into your drinks from plastic kettles. 10 News+ speaks to an expert on how to avoid drinking plastic. title: Melbourne Man Charged After Allegedly Shooting Crossbow At Police | 10 News
description: A 26-year-old man has been charged after he allegedly fired a crossbow at police in Melbourne’s North East. Detectives say Eltham man Dylan Perri refused to co-operate with officers, ultimately forcing them to shoot multiple rounds during the tense standoff. title: Four Arrested In South Korea After 120,000 Home Cameras Hacked For ‘Sexploitation’ Videos | 10 News+
description: Authorities in South Korea have arrested four people for allegedly hacking into more than 120,000 cameras in homes and businesses. Police say they targeted karaoke rooms, a Pilates studio, and even a gynaecology clinic, using the footage to make sexually exploitative material for an overseas website. One of the suspects is accused of hacking 63,000 cameras and producing 545 sexually exploitative videos, which he then sold for $36,000 AUD. title: WHO Makes Historic Call On Weight-Loss Drugs Including Ozempic And Wegovy | 10 News+
description: The World Health Organisation has made a landmark decision on weight loss drugs, giving the green light for medications such as Ozempic and Wegovy to be used as long-term treatments for obesity across the world. They've also called for greater access to the drugs, which are currently too expensive for many in developing countries. title: Worries Australian Super Could Be Impacted By Forecast AI Stock Plummet | 10 News+
description: There are growing concerns that Australian superfunds could be compromised if a forecast market meltdown occurs. title: Nuns Who Escaped From Nursing Home Refuse To Stop Posting On Instagram | 10 News
description: When you think of influencers, nuns in their eighties probably don't spring to mind.
